item.title: Buffet against the Market
item.description: Introduction It is often said that Warren Buffet counts among the top investors of all time. This is mainly due to his quite specific investment approach called “value investing”, where he doesn’t just follow the latest trends on the market which, as we all know, can be quite volatile from time to time. No, he rather focuses on the valuation he would give a company, looks at their stock prices, and sees if he can pick a bargain.

item.title: Efficient Frontier
item.description: As we have to pay rather high tuition fees, our idea is to make some money with stocks. item.title: Gender Equality Analysis
item.description: Omega Group plc- Pay Discrimination At the last board meeting of Omega Group Plc., the headquarters of a large multinational company, the issue was raised that women were being discriminated in the company, in the sense that the salaries were not the same for male and female executives. A quick analysis of a sample of 50 employees (of which 24 men and 26 women) revealed that the average salary for men was about 8,700 higher than for women.

item.title: HR Analytics
item.description: IBM HR Analytics We analyse a data set on Human Resoruce Analytics. The IBM HR Analytics Employee Attrition & Performance data set is a fictional data set created by IBM data scientists. Among other things, the data set includes employees’ income, their distance from work, their position in the company, their level of education, etc. A full description can be found on the website.
